maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of CM Policies on the specified server.
This function makes a WMI call to the remote server name that was passed as a function parameter. It calls WMI and returns a list of assigned application policies.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks if a given Hotfix has been applied to a given server.

This function makes a WMI call to the remote server name that was passed as a function parameter. It calls the Win32_QuickFixEngineering WMI class and queries the HotFixID property for the Hotfix ID that was passed as a parameter. The function will return True is the hotfix was found and False if it was not found.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter is required to use this function, it is simply the name of the remote server to query against.
This parameter is required to use this function, it is the name of the Hotfix to check for.
This parameter is required to use this function, it is simply the name of the remote server to query against.
This parameter is required to use this function, it is the name of the Hotfix to check for.

maml:description.maml:para: Invoke Application install
This function makes a WMI call to the remote server name that was passed as a function parameter. This will invoke an application installation.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter is required to use this function, it is simply the name of the remote server to query against.
This parameter is the name of the application to invoke the install action on.
This parameter specifies either the Install or Uninstall method for the install action.
This parameter is required to use this function, it is simply the name of the remote server to query against.
This parameter is the name of the application to invoke the install action on.
This parameter specifies either the Install or Uninstall method for the install action.
